tool.name: aurora_skewer
tool.description: A fast and accurate adapter trimmer for next-generation sequencing single or paired end reads.

regex.description: Check the warnings_and_errors.txt file for more details.

tool.command:
######### each aurora tool generates a html file and have an files path directory associated with it. mkdir -p $report.files_path &&
######### three important paths: ######### 1. path to tool installation directory ######### 2. path to report html ######### 3. path to files_path directory associated with the report output. export TOOL_INSTALL_DIR='${__tool_directory__}' && export REPORT='$report' && export REPORT_FILES_PATH='$report.files_path' &&
############ create a hidden file to store r markdown rendering log touch $report.files_path/.r_rendering.log.txt &&
Rscript '${__tool_directory__}/'skewer_render.R
-o '$report' -d '$report.files_path' -A '$first_reads' -B '$second_reads' -x '$adapter_first_reads' -y '$adapter_second_reads' -m '$trimming_mode' -r '$maximum_allowed_error_rate' -D '$maximum_allowed_indel_error_rate' -q '$quality_trimming_3_end' -Q '$mean_quality' -l '$minimum_read_length' -j '$advanced_options.junction_adapter' -M '$advanced_options.tab_adapter' -b '$advanced_options.barcode' -c '$advanced_options.cut' -n '$advanced_options.filter_degenerative_reads' -u '$advanced_options.filter_undetermined_mate_pair_reads' -f '$advanced_options.format' -z '$advanced_options.compress' -E '$advanced_options.qiime' -F '$advanced_options.quiet' -i '$advanced_options.intelligent' -1 '$trimmed_r1' -2 '$trimmed_r2' -3 '$trimmed_s'

param.name: first_reads
param.label: First reads

param.name: second_reads
param.label: Second reads
param.help: If it is single end reads, ignore this input field and use the "first reads" field only.

param.name: adapter_first_reads
param.label: Adapter sequence/file for the first reads.

param.name: adapter_second_reads
param.label: Adapter sequence/file for the second reads

param.name: trimming_mode
param.label: trimming mode
param.option: anywhere adapter detection and trimming (single end reads)

param.name: maximum_allowed_error_rate
param.label: Maximum allowed error rate

param.name: maximum_allowed_indel_error_rate
param.label: Maximum allowed indel error rate
param.help: The valid range of indel error rate is [0, maximum allowed error rate]

param.name: quality_trimming_3_end
param.label: 3’ end quality trimming

param.name: mean_quality
param.label: Reads filtering by average quality

param.name: minimum_read_length
param.label: Minimum read length allowed after trimming

param.name: junction_adapter
param.label: Junction adapter sequence/file for Nextera Mate Pair reads

param.name: tab_adapter
param.label: TAB delimited file indicates valid forward/reverse adapter pairing

param.name: barcode
param.label: Whether to demultiplex reads according to adapters/primers

param.name: cut
param.label: To hard clip off the 5’ leading bases of the forward primer and reverse primer respectively as the barcodes in amplicon mode

param.name: filter_degenerative_reads
param.label: Whether to filter out highly degenerative reads

param.name: filter_undetermined_mate_pair_reads
param.label: Whether to filter out undetermined mate-pair reads

param.name: format
param.label: Format of FASTQ quality value

param.name: compress
param.label: Whether to compress output in GZIP format

param.name: qiime
param.label: Whether to prepare files required by QIIME

param.name: quiet
param.label: Whether in quiet mode

param.name: intelligent
param.label: Whether to intelligently redistribute reads

tool.help: Read the `tool manual <http://download2.nust.na/pub4/sourceforge/s/project/sk/skewer/skewer_manual.pdf>`_ if you are not sure what parameter values to use.
